variable_options.label: SPI
variable_options.description:
Standardised Precipitation Index
Measure of "drought" using the Standardised Precipitation Index on time scales of 3, 6, 12 and 24 months. A drought measure specified as a precipitation deficit. See McKee et al. (1993) and the SPI User Guide (World Meteorological Organization 2012) for details.

variable_options.label: SPEI
variable_options.description:
Standardised Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index
Measure of "drought" using the Standardised Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index on time scales of 3, 6, 12 and 24 months. A drought measure specified using precipitation and evaporation.

variable_options.label: CDD
variable_options.description:
Maximum length of dry spell: maximum number of consecutive days with RR < 1mm
Let RRij be the daily precipitation amount on day i in period j. Count the largest number of consecutive days where RRij < 1mm.

variable_options.label: CDDCOLD18
variable_options.description:
Cooling degree days:
Annual sum of TM - 18, location-specific base temperature and TM > 18. A measure of the energy demand needed to cool a building.

variable_options.label: CSDI
variable_options.description:
Cold spell duration index: annual count of days with at least 6 consecutive days when TN < 10th percentile
Let TNij be the daily maximum temperature on day i in period j and let TNin10 be the calendar day 10th percentile centred on a 5-day window for the base period 1961-1990. Then the number of days per period is summed where, in intervals of at least 6 consecutive days, TNij < TNin10.

variable_options.label: CSDI3
variable_options.description:
Cold spell duration index: annual count of days with at least 3 consecutive days when TN < 10th percentile
CSDI Annual number of days contributing to events where 3 or more consecutive days experience TN < 10th percentile.

variable_options.label: CWD
variable_options.description:
Maximum length of wet spell: maximum number of consecutive days with RR ≥ 1mm
Let RRij be the daily precipitation amount on day i in period j. Count the largest number of consecutive days where RRij ≥ 1mm.

variable_options.label: FD
variable_options.description:
Number of frost days
Annual count of days when TN (daily minimum temperature) < 0°C. Let TNij be daily minimum temperature on day i in year j. Count the number of days where TNij < 0 °C.

variable_options.label: GDDGROW10
variable_options.description:
Growing degree days
Annual sum of TM - 10, base temperature and TM > 10. A measure of the energy demand needed to cool a building.

variable_options.label: GSL
variable_options.description:
Growing season length
Annual* count between the first span of at least 6 days with daily mean temperature TG > 5°C and the first span after July 1st (Jan 1st in SH) of 6 days with TG <5 °C. Let TGij be daily mean temperature on day i in year j. Count the number of days between the first occurrence of at least 6 consecutive days with TGij > 5 °C and the first occurrence after 1st July (Jan 1st in SH) of at least 6 consecutive days with TGij < 5 °C. * Annual means Jan 1st to Dec 31st in the Northern Hemisphere (NH); July 1st to June 30th in the Southern Hemisphere (SH).

variable_options.label: HDDHEAT18
variable_options.description:
Heating degree days
Annual sum of 18 - TM, location-specific base temperature and TM < 18. A measure of the energy demand needed to heat a building.

variable_options.label: SU
variable_options.description:
Number of summer days
Annual count of days when TX (daily maximum temperature) > 25°C. Let TXij be daily minimum temperature on day i in year j. Count the number of days where TXij > 25 °C.

variable_options.label: TMGE10
variable_options.description:
TM of greater than or equal to 10 °C
Number of days when TM (daily mean temperature) ≥ 10 °C.

variable_options.label: TMGE5
variable_options.description:
TM of greater than or equal to 5 °C
Number of days when TM (daily mean temperature) ≥ 5 °C.

variable_options.label: TMLT10
variable_options.description:
TM of at least 10 °C
Number of days when TM (daily mean temperature) < 10 °C.

variable_options.label: TMLT5
variable_options.description:
TM of at least 5 °C
Number of days when TM (daily mean temperature) < 5 °C.

variable_options.label: TMM
variable_options.description:
Mean TM
The mean daily mean temperature.

variable_options.label: TN10P
variable_options.description:
Percentage of days when TN < 10th percentile
Let TNij be the daily minimum temperature on day i in period j and let TNin10 be the calendar day 10th percentile centred on a 5-day window for the base period 1961-1990. The percentage of time for the base period is determined where TNij < TNin10. To avoid possible inhomogeneity across the in-base and out-base periods, the calculation for the base period (1961-1990) requires the use of a bootstrap procedure.

variable_options.label: TN90P
variable_options.description:
Percentage of days when TN > 90th percentile
Let TNij be the daily minimum temperature on day i in period j and let TNin90 be the calendar day 90th percentile centred on a 5-day window for the base period 1961-1990. The percentage of time for the base period is determined where TNij > TNin90. To avoid possible inhomogeneity across the in-base and out-base periods, the calculation for the base period (1961-1990) requires the use of a bootstrap processure.

variable_options.label: TNLTM20

variable_options.label: TNM

variable_options.label: TNN
variable_options.description:
Minimum value of daily minimum temperature
Let TNn be the daily minimum temperatures in month k, period j. The minimum daily minimum temperature each month is then TNnkj = min(TNnkj)

variable_options.label: TNX
variable_options.description:
Maximum value of daily minimum temperature
Let TNx be the daily minimum temperatures in month k, period j. The maximum daily minimum temperature each month is then TNxkj = max(TNxkj).

variable_options.label: TR
variable_options.description:
Number of tropical nights
Annual count of days when TN (daily minimum temperature) > 20 °C. Let TNij be daily minimum temperature on day i in year j. Count the number of days where TNij > 20 °C.

variable_options.label: TX10P

To avoid possible inhomogeneity across the in-base and out-base periods, the calculation for the base period (1961-1990) requires the use of a bootstrap processure.
